alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 10:40PM EST until February 15 at 6:18AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun, Lexington and Richland Counties. Pee Dee River At Cheraw affecting Marlboro and Chesterfield Counties. North Fork Edisto River At Orangeburg affecting Orangeburg County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:11 PM EST Monday the stage was 118.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:11 PM EST Monday was 118.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 108.9 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1030 AM EST.
